original: Johansson, Noak Albert, grosshandlare, Varberg, f. 17/8/78 i Krogsereds s :n. Hall. 1., av Johannes Nilsson o. Eva Andersson. G. 06 m. Jenny Johansson. Barn: Jarl f. 07, Arthur 08. Gunnar 09, Greta 10, Elsa 12, Gunhild 20. — Anst. i faderns firma, övertog denna 01, grund, firma Varberg^ Trävaruexport 10, deläg. o. fd. verkst, dir. f. Varbergs Träförädling, fd. äg. av Vasse egend. i Horred, verkst. dir. o, led. av styr. f. Varberg-Ätrans Järnv. 26-32. Led. av stadsfullm. 16-38, av drätselkamm. o. skolstyr. 22-36, ordf. i Varbergs miss iförs. sed. 16 o. i Var-bergs frikyrkl. samarb rkomm., ordf. i Hall. Ansgariifören. sed. 28.
translated: Johansson, Noak Albert, merchant, Varberg, born on August 17, 1878 in the parish of Krogsered, Halland county, Sweden, to parents Johannes Nilsson and Eva Andersson. He married Jenny Johansson in 1906 and they had six children: Jarl (born 1907), Arthur (born 1908), Gunnar (born 1909), Greta (born 1910), Elsa (born 1912), and Gunhild (born 1920). Noak worked in his father's company and took over the business in 1901. He founded the company Varberg Wood Export in 1910 and was a part-owner and former director of Varbergs Wood Processing. He was also the former owner of the Vasse estate in Horred and a director and board member of Varberg-Ätran Railway from 1926 to 1932. Noak was a member of the city council from 1916 to 1938 and a member of the finance committee and school board from 1922 to 1936. He was also the chairman of the Varbergs Missionary Society since 1916 and the Varbergs Free Church Cooperation Committee. He served as the chairman of Hallands Ansgarii Association since 1928.
